questions.question: What is the primary purpose of channel equalization in wireless communication?

answers.b: To reverse or compensate for the effects of the wireless channel on the signal

explanations.a: Equalization aims to counteract channel-induced distortions like multipath fading to recover the original transmitted signal accurately.
